title.rendered: Where to Stream CINCH Playoff 2023 online

content.rendered:
The CINCH Playoff Series Championship 2023 is the final showdown for ProRodeo athletes vying for a chance to qualify for the prestigious Wrangler National Finals Rodeo. This high-stakes rodeo event promises thrills, spills, and top-notch rodeo action. In this article, we’ll provide you with all the essential information you need to know about this exciting championship.

When is CINCH Playoff 2023?

The CINCH Playoff Series Championship 2023 is scheduled to take place from September 28th to September 30th, 2023. Mark your calendars for three days of heart-pounding rodeo action.

Where is CINCH Playoff 2023?

This thrilling championship will be held at the Denny Sanford Premier Center in Sioux Falls, South Dakota. With a seating capacity of 12,000, this state-of-the-art venue is sure to provide an electrifying atmosphere for rodeo fans.

What Time is CINCH Playoff 2023?

The action kicks off on September 28, 2023, at 7:30 PM Eastern Time (ET). Rodeo enthusiasts should prepare to tune in at this time to catch the excitement.

What TV Channel is CINCH Playoff 2023?

Rodeo fans can catch all the action of the CINCH Playoff Series Championship 2023 on The Cowboy Channel. Here are some of the major TV providers where you can find The Cowboy Channel:

  • AT&T (Channel 566)
  • Charter Spectrum
  • Comcast
  • Cox
  • DirecTV (Channel 603)
  • DISH (Channel 232)
  • Mediacom
  • Suddenlink
  • Sling TV’s Heartland Package
  • Verizon FiOS TV

How to Watch CINCH Playoff 2023 Live Online?

For those who prefer to stream the rodeo action online, there are several options available:

  • Cowboy Channel+ Apps: You can watch the CINCH Playoff Series Championship 2023 on various platforms, including Android TV, Apple TV, Fire TV, Roku, and select models of Samsung TV.
  • Vidgo: Gain access to Cowboy Channel+ by subscribing to Vidgo for just $20 per month.
  • Sling TV: Sling TV offers the Heartland Package, which includes access to The Cowboy Channel. You can subscribe to Sling TV to stream the event online.
  • Value Channels on FreeCast: Access Value Channels on FreeCast for only $6.99 a month and enjoy free unlimited DVR to catch all the rodeo action.

How to Stream CINCH Playoff Online from Anywhere

If you find yourself outside the United States during the CINCH Playoff Series Championship 2023 and want to catch the action, you can use a Virtual Private Network (VPN) to stream the event from anywhere. Here’s how:

  • Choose a reputable VPN service that offers servers in the United States.
  • Download and install the VPN app on your preferred device.
  • Connect to a US server location.

Once connected, you will have a US IP address, allowing you to access The Cowboy Channel’s online streaming platforms as if you were in the US.

Visit the official streaming platforms mentioned earlier, such as Cowboy Channel+ or Sling TV, and sign up or log in to access the live stream.

ProRodeo Events

  • Bareback Riding
  • Saddle Bronc Riding
  • Bull Riding
  • Tie-down Roping
  • Team Roping
  • Steer Wrestling

Cinch Playoffs Format

Competitors in events such as bareback riding, steer wrestling, team roping, saddle bronc riding, tie-down roping, bull riding, barrel racing, and breakaway roping will be accumulating points at the NFR Playoff Series Rodeos, which consist of the top 60 paying rodeos for this season.

The initial stage of the playoffs will feature the top 24 contestants from the Playoff Series Standings, who will commence their competition in Puyallup, Washington. Following this, the top 4 finishers from this event and the top 8 contestants from the Playoff Series Standings will advance to the next round in Sioux Falls, South Dakota, scheduled for the last weekend of the season on Sept. 28-30.

In Sioux Falls, the top 12 participants will take part in Rounds 1 and 2, after which the field will be narrowed down to the top 8 based on aggregate scores. These top 8 will then compete with a clean slate in a subsequent round, and the top 4 from that round will proceed to a winner-take-all Short Round.

The expected prize payouts for each performance are as follows:

Rounds 1 and 2

  • 1st Place: $12,099
  • 2nd Place: $9,166
  • 3rd Place: $6,599
  • 4th Place: $4,399
  • 5th Place: $2,566
  • 6th Place: $1,833

Final Four

  • 1st Place: $16,355
  • 2nd Place: $12,266
  • 3rd Place: $8,177
  • 4th Place: $4,077

It’s worth noting that as of now, 12 of the NFR Playoff rodeos have already concluded.

The CINCH Playoff Series Championship 2023 is set to be a thrilling showcase of rodeo talent, offering one last chance for ProRodeo athletes to secure their spot in the Wrangler National Finals Rodeo. With the provided information on dates, location, TV channels, and online streaming options, you can ensure you don’t miss a moment of the action, no matter where you are. So, saddle up and get ready for an unforgettable rodeo experience!
